docs.lead_paragraph: With less than two weeks until the election, Gov. George E. Pataki and his Democratic opponent, Peter F. Vallone, both kept their campaigning low-key yesterday. Mr. Pataki's sole campaign event was an appearance on the ''Rambling With Gambling'' morning radio show on WOR-AM, where he touted the achievements of his first four years in office, but said he needed four more years.

headline.main: A Low-Key Day for Pataki and Vallone

docs.abstract: New York State Gov George E Pataki and his Democratic opponent, Peter F Vallone, both keep their campaigning low-key; Pataki touts achievements of his first term and expresses his support for keeping New York Yankees in Bronx; Vallone reiterates his call for state-run health care plan and need for improving services for elderly; says he has given up on luring Pataki into debate; photo (M)
